Reviews.Title: “keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: NYSTATEOFMIND777
Reviews.Content: This was my family’s first vacation to Ocean City, Maryland and might very well be the worst vacation ever. I knew going in that this motel was “older” and needed updating but was advised that it was clean and convenient and the price was too reasonable to believe. That should have been my first red flag. First off, the motel is not clean. Upon entering the room, I could tell that something was up when I entered the bathroom and it smelled so bad, like mold or something, I almost passed out because it was so contained in that small area. I had to clean everything myself with Clorox wipes before using anything. Everything in this hotel must be original from when it was built except the TV’s and the swimming pool. I would bet anything that our room was not cleaned after the prior customer checked out. Paper thin sheets and blankets (must be original since they opened), hairs everywhere on bedding and yellow and blood looking stains on bedding and pillows. Tiny, dirty bathroom, rusty hinges and faucets , moldy smell, tiny abrasive hand towels are supposed to be used as bath towels??, (we were 4 people, with 2 tiny hand towels). We had to use our own beach blankets as bath towels. Table and 2 chairs are right up against the bed, barely any room to get by. if you are overweight, you're in trouble. The pool was small, one of the men in the pool was in his street clothes. There is a list of rules on the gate of the pool area. It is interesting how the Empress Motel wants to impose rules on their customers but don't feel customers should impose any rules on them or have any expectations of them. To top it off, this motel should be renamed the Empress Old Age Home. Everyone around the pool was elderly and were not happy to see younger folks with children. They were not friendly, gave us dirty looks, and just stared us down at the pool as if we were on their turf. They were annoyed if my kids were having fun in the pool and gave a stern stare at that. This is a pool people, not a library. If you want to nap, go to your room. If you want to read, go to a library. Don’t expect people who paid to come on vacation to be quiet in a swimming pool, especially young children, remember that was once you. It's pretty bad when your children want to go home on vacation. WORD OF ADVICE, DON’T BRING CHILDREN HERE, THIS IS NOT A KID FRIENDLY ESTABLISHMENT. SECOND, SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE; YOUR BUSINESS IS NOT APPRECIATED HERE. THEY DON’T TAKE PRIDE IN THEIR BUSINESS BECAUSE IF THEY DID THEY WOULD UPDATE AND CARE ABOUT PEOPLE (NOT JUST COLLECT MONEY TO LINE THEIR POCKETS). They actually gave Ocean City, Maryland a bad name in our eyes. Don’t know if we would ever visit OC again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap & quiet”
Reviews.Author: CandaceJoy
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to OC throughout the years and have watched it become an extreme tourist attraction and prices have increased for everything including outrageously priced hotels! So when I saw Empress rated at the top of hotels in OC, I thought I'd give it a try--especially at $91/night and it turned out to be worth it. The reviews are accurate. I found it to be an older, yet clean motel. It doesn't have an elevator so be prepared if you have lots of luggage or problems doing stairs. Also, the mattresses are hard and covered with plastic. The A/C was great though and a welcome relief and it was so quiet at night and in the morning I never heard any noises. The pool is small and doesn't stay open late but it was still a nice relief from the heat. and about The location is also great being on 20th Street with mini-golf and Philips Seafood around the corner. Also rented bikes next door at Eden Roc for $6/hr. Even though it's not right on the boardwalk, if you get a corner room, they have a balcony that has view of ocean. Would definitely stay again for the value!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: L0l_223
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived in OC on 08/23/12, because we arrived before check in time we decided to go to the beach. While there my children ages 2 and 3 years of age got sand all over there bodies. Trying to clean them up and walking away from the boardwalk I saw a family rinsing off sand from their feet with a waterhose that belonged to the Empress Motel. I did see a sign which stated "only for guest" and went on to use the waterhose with the thought in mind to rent two rooms at this facility for four days. The manager,owner or who ever it was that so rudely approched us and literally yanked the waterhose from our hands said "get out of here"!!! I felt awakered at that moment and angered by his reaction and asked him, "Sir, how do you know we are not guest here"? The rude man said I don't know! I then asked him if that is how he treats his guest and he said no. The rude man then said I don't remember you checking in! It was about 11:30 AM.. no one checks in around this time!!. I then in turn replied you are an "A-HOLE"!! He then replied why don't you go back from where you came from! I am hispanic and proud of it... I don't know if he was referring to my race or telling me to go back to CT. I didn't bother to answer him for people like this are a loss cause in life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: tmil725
Reviews.Content: Decent old school hotel/motel for the cost. Nice folks working the desk, security and cleaning crew. A little noisy at times as its of older brick and wood construction. A lot of smokers outside during our stay made it difficult to sit on the balcony for long periods. Would recommend the owners create smoking zones away from rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good family motel”
Reviews.Author: UMTerpVirginia
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently returned from a stay at the Empress. I want to thank everyone who had written previous reviews and allowed us to find this gem! It really is a 50's throwback in a lot of ways - actual keys to the room, 4" yellow tile in the bathroom, small sink, double-sized beds, manually typed receipt! The motel is very well maintained and kept very clean. Someone was always cleaning inside and outside most of the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful! Loved the location! The primary downside to this motel was the waterproof mattress covers on the beds! I understand the "need" for these with a family-oriented motel but they made were very noisy every time one of us turned over in the bed! I guess we should have checked about taking them off. Overall, a great place to stay although I think we realized that we have outgrown sharing double-sized beds with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Overall decent place.”
Reviews.Author: Asakadales
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the empress in the middle of August 2012. Overall it was a nice place to stay. The room was cheap, it had a great location, and the people who worked there were nice. My only complaint would be when we first got there I went Into the bathroom and there was fecal matter on the toilet seat. We had brought Lysol wipes so that took care of that. It seemed like every towel they brought us was dirty with what looked to be blood and/or feces.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: carolinenabdi
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel just a few days before our stay as a last minute vacation because of the great reviews. Unfortunately had a family emergency (7week old baby got sick) and the hotel was totally accommodating. We really appreciate their help. Thank you JD and owner. Can't wait to come back next year when the kids are a bit older.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: 972EdnaB
Reviews.Content: Just my husband and I for a 2 night getaway to OCMD. Found this place on here called to get a rate. When they quoted me 2 nights at $155 per night I immediately booked it. Everything online was well over $200 per night for a weekend. Arrived and check in was smooth- ladies behind the counter were funny. Had to pay up front- didn't require a credit card which was nice. Room was decent & clean. Floors were scary- but it's the beach. Air conditioner wasn't cold. We called the front desk and they came to check it out right away- we were headig out for the night and they said they had a call in to maintenance. When we came back it was either replaced or fixed- it was nice and cold- made us happy. Pool looked decent although we didn't use it. There was a vending machine for soda/water and snacks. Beds were pretty hard- and each room has 2 double beds. Not sure if we would stay here again- depends on our budget- this was definitely a budget friendly motel - no frills. Flat screen TV very small fridge & Microwave- again good for 2 nights max in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RobinKLittleFalls
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing motel. My husband, myself and our two boys stayed here. It was the best family vacation ever. Very clean and the staff was so nice. The beach and boardwalk are only steps away. Everything was pretty much within walking distance. We loved the ocean and beach. The motel has a pool which is cleaned and serviced daily. Only wish they had a coffe maker in the room. That would be my only complaint. Otherwise it was the best stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully Helpful July 16th - July 19th”
Reviews.Author: Carol W
Reviews.Content: I am hoping this review will be as helpful as others were to me. The Empress Motel is very convenient to the Boardwalk and the beach. It may be an older place but it is very clean and quiet. The room rates were very reasonable. The pool was always clean and very refreshing. I would recommend the Empress Motel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “June 18-21 2012”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: Very clean,convenient to Boardwalk and beach, great price . Save your money. This place is friendly and a great location. Enjoyed our visit (my wife and I). Staying during the week Sunday - Thursday is a great way to do OC and see it all and avoid the weekend crowds. Have done it this way for several years. You could pay $100 more easily and not have as nice of an experience. Rooms easily accommodate up to a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice, Clean, and close to the beach"”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this motel for the last two years and every time we have stay here always very clean, and nice staff. Looking forward to staying here again this weekend for soccer and the air show.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Pastalover777
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter and her friend last August 2011. We stayed for a week and LOVED it. The staff was so personable and accomodating. The room was clean and we loved that the beach and board walk are right out the back door! We didn't have to get in the car and drive anywhere. The pool was very clean also! We are already booked for this summer and can't wait to get there! Kimberly

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jubo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at this motel for the past 5 years for Ocean City's Springfest. The staff (Susan, Paula and Yvonne) are very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping does a wonderful job. You are 1/2 block from the beach and boardwalk and 1 block from the main drag, Coastal Highway, where you can catch the bus and ride all day for $3.00. Close to restaurants, miniature golf and Anthony's, which has OC's best breakfast sandwich. YUMMY. My only complaint would be to upgrade the bath towels. They are very thin and don't absorb much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: mariell98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Empress in August 2011. This was a nice clean hotel with very friendly staff. The amenities were a great value for the price. The location was perfect and only steps from the boardwalk. It was walking distance to Phillips Crab House, shopping, and putt-putt golf. The pool was in good repair and there were enough lounge chairs for everyone even at full capacity. The only downside was the usual musty smell of most older Ocean City properties. I say this because it is the same at almost all the properties we have ever stayed in in OC. The second and third floor corner rooms have a nice view of the ocean with a balcony to sit out at night. We enjoyed our stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Empress Still Has It !”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: My wife and her mom has stayed at the Empress for 25+ yrs, the last time being in 2006. Her mom passed away in May 2007 and she hadn't been back since. Her cousin Bob made our resrevations for Aug 21>Aug 25 this year and the Empress still has the cleanliness, the charm and just enough ammenities to make a vacation at O.C. memorable and enjoyable. The staff is friendly, the rooms and pool are very clean and the ammenities (frig,,t.v. and microwave are all you need although we did take a coffee pot for morning coffee. Within 50ft of the beach we will stay at the Empress as long as she stands and recommend her to everyone..Thanks for a nice vacation, Tom & Barb Lyons, Cumberland, MD

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KL1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking to find a nice hotel at a decent price and we found it at the Empress. I had called some of the hotels we've stayed at before, only to find the prices ridiculous. I decided to check reviews on tripadvisor. The Empress had very good reviews so I decided to give it a try and I'm very glad that I did. It is in fact, one of the older motels, and we actually like them better than the new, huge chain hotels. The staff was extremely pleasant, the room was spotless, the pool was sparkling and the location was just terrific. And for almost $100 per night LESS than the hotel one block over, how can anyone not like that? This hotel suited our needs and we most definitely will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Bartles2
Reviews.Content: Ocean City has gotten very expensive as far as motels. I have stayed at quite a few places here and the Empress has been the best all around. The rooms are not fancy but are very clean. Nice flat screen tv's as well as microwave and small fridge. The bathrooms are small but are very clean and also have blowdryers on the wall. I felt very comfortable staying here. It was a quiet,peaceful stay. The only thing I think would make the motel a better place is if the pool stayed open longer. It closes at 7:00 pm every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Older Motel”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: News flash to other travelers: the two and three story motels that you see from 30th street on down? They were built in the 50's and 60's. Most of them are family owned and not part of some huge chain that can afford to remodel every 5 years. So, if you're not OK with smaller, older-looking accommodations, don't stay at these places! Rant over. We had a nice 4-night stay at the Empress. Prices were reasonable for the peak season. I went with my husband and his parents. It was a bit tight with 4 adults, but perfectly manageable. The TV was new LCD and got all of the usual cable channels. The bathroom was clean. The beds were fine. They are full, not queen sized. Housekeeping came everyday. Maintenance was also on-grounds everyday. The staff was very helpful. We couldn't find our car keys right before we were set to check-out. The staff helped us tear apart the room to search for the keys and let us keep our car there past check-out. The only thing I didn't really like about the Empress was the low water pressure in the shower. I think they may be using low-flow shower heads. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: softnsable
Reviews.Content: Just got back lastnight from a wonderful trip to OC, staying at this quaint and quiet motel is just what I needed. From the staff in the office to the housecleaners and the gentleman that kept busy cleaning the pool and all of the chairs every morning.Somebody had swept thhe patio outside of every room. I was so impressed! You can tell they all take pride in their work to ensure us to have a great time.! I have been to many upperscale places in oc only to find they were dirty, they stunk and it just did not seem for all the money they wanted it was worth it. So, it was on the boardwalk, who cares for twice as much money and dirty, it's not my thing. I will certainly be back again, I loved everything about it. Hope to make reservations next year there♥

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: ThePrincessPa
Reviews.Content: One of the older and smaller motels at the beach. I was so surprised when the room key was an actual key!! The room was SMALL. My husband and I kept bumping into each other while we were unpacking. No alarm clock, no coffeemaker. The WORST mattress I have ever slept on! The entire motel is non smoking which I liked, but they do provide these "lovely" white buckets filled with sand marked "butt buckets" that everyone seemed to have in front of their rooms. So as you're walking to your room you're passing through clouds of smoke. YUCK!! Great location, but not a place I'll be returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money but not much more”
Reviews.Author: robmac57
Reviews.Content: The Empress's location is a plus - half block from the boardwalk/ocean and close enough to a number of mid-town restaraunts & nitespots. The motel appeared well cared for but was obviously stuck in 1957 which was probably near to when it was built. The tipoff should have been when the room key was an actual key - not an entry card. The bathrooms are clean but small allowing only a 1 foot by 9 " stainless steel shelf for all your toiletries - kinda' like a prison might have. The toilet's handle needed to be held down during the entire flush otherwise it wouldn't work. NO coffeemaker. Since we were only staying 3 nights this year (a bigger Disney trip planned for next April) we decided to save a few bucks on length of stay and accomodations. Usually we enjoy the Grand Hotel 2 blocks away. Clearly the Empress is not the Grand. But we knew that going in. Even so, if you are looking for clean but spartan accomodations - the Empress might suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jyd2
Reviews.Content: The pool is more like a library than a swimming pool. The staff there seemed they would rather shoot daggers at you than assist you in any way. Although the staff was not the friendliest, the place was immaculate. The location is terrific being as close to the beach as any establishment is without being ocean front. If you do not have small children, then this place would be absolutely perfect(minus the courtesy of staff).

Reviews.Title: “Best little motel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Postman948
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Empress Motel this year and found it just as nice as our first visit. The entire staff cares about keeping the hotel clean and your trip enjoyable. We see the same people working at the Empress year after year. The front desk, maintainance, and housekeeping were friendly , helpful and wonderful to talk to. The motel is simple. Two double beds, mini-frig, microwave and flat screen TV. The outside pool gets sun all day not like some hotels on the boardwalk that block the sun. The Empress is not on the boardwalk (only 175 feet away) but from our back window we could see the ocean. It was nice to sit outside our room at night and see the activity on the street. Linda from housekeeping kept our room clean as did the other hotel staff to the pool and grounds. If you plan to come to the Empress motel to be loud and party, then find another place. The motel has three floors and no elevators. We loved the third floor but consider the first or second floor if you have problems climbing stairs with your luggage. This place is quiet and enjoyable and always has repeat customers. The Empress is near many restaurants, like my favorite FishTales. We totally loved the Empress Motel as it is an Oldie but Goodie or better yet, a Classic.

Reviews.Title: “nice, no frills hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler122
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we booked a weekend stay at the Empress Motel in late August. The good reviews were spot on: the motel is in a fantastic location just off the boardwalk. The rooms were clean and we enjoyed the flat screen tv and the mini fridge and microwave were very convenient. Even though our room was just off of the highway, it was fairly soundproof and we got a good night's sleep (although the mattresses were not the most comfortable). This motel is for those who want a basic room in a great location at a low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: cole24
Reviews.Content: We have always stay at the empress motel, it's always clean (everytime) I am very picky person, We are always happy when we come. And yes, as to other comments we always bring out toiletre... with us, and towel are small, but any hotel where you stay they always seem to have small towels :) For years we always stayed in the "motel room" this year we finally decided to stay in one of the effien.. rooms for the very first time (they only have two, which I am sure everyone knows. But, the only thing I can say is that the effien.. rooms are not worth the money, the "kitchen" as they say you can barely get to, its a small area with the kitchen table right in the middle of the carpet, so I little tight, you have to move the kitchen table just to get to the small area, sink, stove, etc... So, it's more worth just staying in the "motel room" and going out to places to eat. Otherwise, always happy and always clean, and its nice to keep all your beach stuff, sand and all outside of the room, instead of bring the sand in the room. Worth to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for Best motel in OC for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Straitfan1946
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Empress for many years now and love it. Have tried others but always come back here when able. Not always able to get a room if we don't book early. Was just there this past week with family from Florida and had the usual good experience. I love that I've never encountered anything but clean rooms, friendly helpful staff, and a quiet stay close to the beach. Need to check on a room for next week but probably too late! And agree with one review above about Capt. Gallery in west OC--BEST crabcakes in town!! Ate there again this trip and everything was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: rufus4926
Reviews.Content: Very surprised - Very clean and friendly staff - very quiet - had an a/c problem, but it was taken care of promptly. - best part - did not see any bugs !!!! inside or out - short walk to ocean/boardwalk - great location for my teenagers, turn em loose and let em go, so I could spend time in the sun on the beach - perfect. Very clean pool area with very comfy loungers. Will return

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Empress”
Reviews.Author: LM50
Reviews.Content: Always looking for a bargain, we recently stayed here for the first time (after reading previous TripAdvisor reviews). We have stayed in numerous places in Ocean City over the years and were totally impressed with everything about the Empress. This may be an older building but it has been well taken care of - the maintenance shows. Freshly painted, flat screen TV, and very clean. One evening (sitting outside our room) we witnessed the night manager checking every floor as well as the parking lot to make sure everything was secure.Everyone who worked there was very nice and it was refreshing to see a well cared for (family owned) Ocean City motel still thriving and that they have not let it fall into a high priced ruin like so many other places in Ocean City. If you are looking for a no frills, clean and fairly priced place to stay this would be it. Hopefully this charming motel will be around for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: aismith
Reviews.Content: As others have said, found hotel nice and clean. Very nice family run business. Room was standard two double comfortable beds, a table and two chairs, a dresser with two large drawers, microwave and small refrig, and nice new lcd TV. Bathroom may be considered on the smaller side by some, but I thought it was fine. Most importantly, everything was clean and kept up. That was very important to me as my immune system is very compromised from cancer, and the horror stories on this site for other places worried me. When people talk about "the mildew and mold smell hits you", that translates to me as a potential life threatening fungal infection. That is definitely NOT at the Empress. I did not get the impression in the rooms or anywhere else that any problems had been "quick fixed" or sloppily patched. As another review noted, the place is older, but is not rundown at all. Yes, the towels are smaller and thin (they're standard motel utility issue) but the nice cleaning staff will gladly accommodate you with as many as you want. The location is nice, as you are just a couple steps from the boardwalk/ocean without crossing any streets, and bike rental is right beside you. One suggestion might be to consider a Wi-Fi connection. Overall a nice, reasonably priced pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: beelacat
Reviews.Content: This is the second year that we have stayed in the Empress and were once again completely satisfied. The hotel is an older model hotel but it is clean overall and functional. It has the basics – bed, bath, dresser and AC. They also recently upgraded to new AC units, microwaves, mini refrigerators and flat screen TV’s. The beds are not the most comfortable because they are the less expensive line of spring mattresses and the towels are small but they each served their purpose. The housekeeping lady was really nice and did a good job. Since we were only there for 4 days, we didn’t ask her to clean the room but we did ask for a new set of towels. She said no problem and brought them back to us within 10 minutes. She did check on us each day to make sure that we we’re ok. The hotel has outside entrances (with real keys, not the credit card type key) and is a very short distance to the boardwalk between 19th and 20th street. This is more of a family oriented hotel and the owner, who is also very nice, really does a good job of screening the guests. (Unlike the hotel across the street who had a lot of high school seniors staying there.) We made use of the outdoor pool which was great. A bit cool because the weather hasn’t been all that hot, but once I got in, I didn’t want to get out. The pool was very clean and several times during our stay, we saw them checking the chlorine levels and cleaning the filters. We are already planning to come back next year and will definitely stay at this hotel. It’s within walking distance to restaurants and activities or if you’d rather go to the end of the boardwalk, you can catch the trolley that runs the length of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: shasha1946
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Empress Motel for over 20+ years. My husband and I have stayed there 2 years and have booked again for this summer. The Motel is family owned and operated. They also are selective of who they rent to to ensure a family atmosphere so you won't find wild senior week kids here. While there are no bells and whistles and everything is very basic and the decor dated it is the cleanest place I have ever stayed. The maids do an amazing job and the place is always spotless. The value is great, you won't find a better rate. The location is also why we select this motel as it's on the ocean side so you don't have to cross any roads with the kids to get to the beack and it's just steps from the boardwalk also. The motel is 3 levels with no elevator so if you are traveling with small children a guest who cannot do stairs you will want to try to request a 1st floor room. We have always requested this to avoid dragging the kids up and down the steps and have never had a problem getting one. The motel also has a nice size pool (no life guard). We will continue to take our family here. You can't beat the value and the family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: catwoman1175
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here for the past few years and we made reservations again for this year (2010). The staff is always friendly and rooms are well kept. You must bring your own toiletries though. We think it is a good location for boardwalk and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Postman948
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews for this motel before I booked it. I must say that they were correct. This place is a gem. The motel is minutes from the boardwalk and beach. The room was average in size with a mini-frig and microwave. Most of all, the room was clean and well kept. We have stayed in other motels in OC and nothing can compare to how the staff takes pride in keeping the rooms and property clean and well kept. Our room was ready early which was real nice. The owner and the employees were all so nice which is not always the case at other motels. We talked to one guest who has been coming back to this motel for 20 years. I guess I have 19 to go. The location is great and I am looking forward to staying here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Annual mecca”
Reviews.Author: Kerri T
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stay the same week every year, and as all of the other reviewers have mentioned this is the place we always stay. The rates are affordable, the hotel is basic, but it is kept clean. Nice, clean pool area. We always joke about the big, thirsty towels-but they do the trick. We have always been satisfied with our stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great price, near the beach-what more could you want”
Reviews.Author: justbeachy46
Reviews.Content: This was a great basic motel at an awesome price. Very family oriented and quiet. The room was so clean, bright and smelled wonderful. The outside areas of the motel are also kept very clean. Front desk staff is friendly and accomodating. The rooms are non-smoking, but they provide "butt buckets" filled with sand to use outside of your room. Nice pool, but too cold to use it that time of year. Some people did, though, but I'm not that daring. It's really just a half block from the beach and boardwalk, and you can get a room with an ocean view, albeit from that half block away. The room had a mini fridge, microwave, blow dryer, tv and small table and chairs in front of the window. Dresser has only 2 drawers but there were two luggage racks in the room. There's no latch lock on the door to keep someone with keys out when in your room, just doorknob lock and deadbolt. There's plenty of parking in front and around the back. Others are right, the towels are small but they give you lots of them, and the shower water pressure is pretty low. There are vending machines for snacks and drinks in the hallways. Ditto for ice, but you have to pay for it. I assume the maids do a great job, based on the cleanliness of the room when we checked in, but we never used their services because they come quite early, too early in my opinion. All it took was that first morning to have one pounding on the door at 9am-ish and we put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door the rest of the week. It's a vacation and I don't necessarily want to get up and out that early. This might not be an issue for you, but in my experience I've never had maid service arrive that early. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A good family place”
Reviews.Author: boboshe
Reviews.Content: This is a nice family oriented place to stay for a reasonable price. Even though it is an older motel, it is well cared for, clean and the staff is always friendly and helpful. We have been staying there for more than 25 years. The staff screens its tenants, which helps make it a friendly family place. It is close to the boardwalk (1/2 block), Phillips, and our favorite lunch place Anthonys.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Sammy79
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and looking for a family friendly motel then this is the place. They are careful of who they let stay the this motel. I stayed during 4th of July weekend. It was located half a block from the board walk on 20th street. There's nothing fancy about the motel. It looks as though its been a couple of decades since they last updated the rooms but it's kept simple and clean. The only complaint I have are the towels. Bring your own bathroom towels. There's no way you will be able to wrap yourself in a towel after a shower unless you are a size 0.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: ziggy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empress July 30-Aug. 5. It is one of the cleanest places I have ever stayed. We don't go for fancy--just the basics. I loved the location! You are pretty much right on the boardwalk and within walking distance of stores, restaurants, mini golf, and bike rentals right next door. Also good places to get coffee, breakfast items, etc. The pool was very clean and the property is well tended to. Our housekeeper Linda did a great job. You can't beat the price and location if all you want is a nice clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Fupa
Reviews.Content: The Empress is a good choice. This is a nice, clean, conveniently located hotel. It is not oceanfront, but almost. The rooms are well cared for, clean and comfortable. This is just what you need for an Ocean City vacation. You can walk to the beach, to the store, to restaurants. Bike rentals are right next door. The service people are very good. It has a nice pool too. The thing I like about it is you can tell the owner's take pride in their property. I would definately recommend the Empress, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a wounderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we love the empress. it's a clean and quiet place to stay. This year will make our fourth year of staying there. We stayed here the first time we went to ocean city and liked it so well we did not look for anyother place to stay. The staff are very nice and it is close to the water.

HotelInfo.Name: Empress Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 20th Street and Baltimore Avenue, Ocean City, MD 21843
